task: The function $g$ is defined by $ g(x) = 9x - 7 $. What is the value of $ g(x) $ when $ x = 1 $?
explanation: Choice D is correct. The value of $ g(x) $ when $ x = 1 $ can be found by substituting 1 for $x$ in the given equation $ g(x) = 9x - 7 $. \nThis yields $ g(1) = 9(1) + -7 $, or $ g(1) = 2 $. Therefore, when $ x = 1 $, the value of $ g(x) $ is $ 2 $.
